column2: Levin was standing rather far off.
column3: Levin was standing rather far off.

column2: They were disputing, as far as he could make out, as to the interpretation to be put on the act and the exact meaning of the words: "liable to be called up for trial."
column3: They were disputing, as far as he could make out, as to the interpretation to be put on the act and the exact meaning of the words: "liable to be called up for trial."

column2: The crowd parted to make way for Sergey Ivanovitch approaching the table.
column3: The crowd parted to make way for Sergey Ivanovitch approaching the table.

column2: Sergey Ivanovitch, waiting till the malignant gentleman had finished speaking, said that he thought the best solution would be to refer to the act itself, and asked the secretary to find the act.
column3: Sergey Ivanovitch, waiting till the malignant gentleman had finished speaking, said that he thought the best solution would be to refer to the act itself, and asked the secretary to find the act.

column2: Sergey Ivanovitch read the act and began to explain its meaning, but at that point a tall, stout, round-shouldered landowner, with dyed whiskers, in a tight uniform that cut the back of his neck, interrupted him.
column3: Sergey Ivanovitch read the act and began to explain its meaning, but at that point a tall, stout, round shouldered landowner, with dyed whiskers, in a tight uniform that cut the back of his neck, interrupted him.

column2: Put it to the vote!
column3: Put it to the vote!

column2: No need for more talking!"
column3: No need for more talking!"

column2: Then several voices began to talk all at once, and the tall nobleman with the ring, getting more and more exasperated, shouted more and more loudly.
column3: Then several voices began to talk all at once, and the tall nobleman with the ring, getting more and more exasperated, shouted more and more loudly.

column2: A ballot!	A ballot!
A ballot!
column3: A ballot!

column2: Every nobleman sees it!
column3: Every nobleman sees it!

column2: We shed our blood for our country!...
column3: We shed our blood for our country!...

column2: The confidence of the monarch....
column3: The confidence of the monarch....

column2: No checking the accounts of the marshal; he's not a cashier....
column3: No checking the accounts of the marshal; he's not a cashier....

column2: But that's not the point.... Votes, please!
column3: But that's not the point.... Votes, please!

column2: Beastly!..." shouted furious and violent voices on all sides.
column3: Beastly!..." shouted furious and violent voices on all sides.

column2: Looks and faces were even more violent and furious than their words.
column3: Looks and faces were even more violent and furious than their words.

column2: They expressed the most implacable hatred.
column3: They expressed the most implacable hatred.

column2: And one vote may decide the whole question, and one must be serious and consecutive, if one wants to be of use in public life, concluded Sergey Ivanovitch.
column3: And one vote may decide the whole question, and one must be serious and consecutive, if one wants to be of use in public life, concluded Sergey Ivanovitch.

column2: But Levin forgot all that, and it was painful to him to see all these excellent persons, for whom he had a respect, in such an unpleasant and vicious state of excitement.
column3: But Levin forgot all that, and it was painful to him to see all these excellent persons, for whom he had a respect, in such an unpleasant and vicious state of excitement.

column2: To escape from this painful feeling he went away into the other room where there was nobody except the waiters at the refreshment bar.
column3: To escape from this painful feeling he went away into the other room where there was nobody except the waiters at the refreshment bar.

column2: Please come, Konstantin Dmitrievitch, he said, "your brother's looking for you.
column3: Please come, Konstantin d mitrievitch, he said, "your brother's looking for you.

column2: They are voting on the legal point."
column3: They are voting on the legal point."

column2: Sergey Ivanovitch put his hand into the box, put the ball somewhere, and making room for Levin, stopped.
column3: Sergey Ivanovitch put his hand into the box, put the ball somewhere, and making room for Levin, stopped.

column2: But the persons speaking paused, and his improper question was overheard.
column3: But the persons speaking paused, and his improper question was overheard.

column2: Sergey Ivanovitch frowned.
column3: Sergey Ivanovitch frowned.

column2: That is a matter for each man's own decision, he said severely.
column3: That is a matter for each man's own decision, he said severely.

column2: A hundred and twenty-six for admission!	A hundred and twenty six for admission!
But the old party did not consider themselves conquered.
column3: But the old party did not consider themselves conquered.

column2: Levin went nearer.
column3: Levin went nearer.

column2: In reply Snetkov spoke of the trust the noblemen of the province had placed in him, the affection they had shown him, which he did not deserve, as his only merit had been his attachment to the nobility, to whom he had devoted twelve years of service.
column3: In reply Snetkov spoke of the trust the noblemen of the province had placed in him, the affection they had shown him, which he did not deserve, as his only merit had been his attachment to the nobility, to whom he had devoted twelve years of service.

column2: Several times he repeated the words: "I have served to the best of my powers with truth and good faith, I value your goodness and thank you," and suddenly he stopped short from the tears that choked him, and went out of the room.
column3: Several times he repeated the words: "I have served to the best of my powers with truth and good faith, I value your goodness and thank you," and suddenly he stopped short from the tears that choked him, and went out of the room.

column2: In the doorway the marshal of the province jostled against Levin.
column3: In the doorway the marshal of the province jostled against Levin.

column2: Beg pardon, excuse me, please, he said as to a stranger, but recognizing Levin, he smiled timidly.
column3: Beg pardon, excuse me, please, he said as to a stranger, but recognizing Levin, he smiled timidly.

column2: It seemed to Levin that he would have liked to say something, but could not speak for emotion.
column3: It seemed to Levin that he would have liked to say something, but could not speak for emotion.

column2: His face and his whole figure in his uniform with the crosses, and white trousers striped with braid, as he moved hurriedly along, reminded Levin of some hunted beast who sees that he is in evil case.
column3: His face and his whole figure in his uniform with the crosses, and white trousers striped with braid, as he moved hurriedly along, reminded Levin of some hunted beast who sees that he is in evil case.

column2: This old man was a touching and pathetic figure to Levin now, and he longed to say something pleasant to him.
column3: This old man was a touching and pathetic figure to Levin now, and he longed to say something pleasant to him.

column2: So you're sure to be our marshal again, he said.
column3: So you're sure to be our marshal again, he said.

column2: It's not likely, said the marshal, looking round with a scared expression.
column3: It's not likely, said the marshal, looking round with a scared expression.

column2: I'm worn out, I'm old.	I'm worn out, I'm old.
And the marshal disappeared through a side door.
column3: And the marshal disappeared through a side door.

column2: The most solemn moment was at hand.
column3: The most solemn moment was at hand.

column2: They were to proceed immediately to the election.
column3: They were to proceed immediately to the election.

column2: The leaders of both parties were reckoning white and black on their fingers.
column3: The leaders of both parties were reckoning white and black on their fingers.

column2: The discussion upon Flerov had given the new party not only Flerov's vote, but had also gained time for them, so that they could send to fetch three noblemen who had been rendered unable to take part in the elections by the wiles of the other party.
column3: The discussion upon Flerov had given the new party not only Flerov's vote, but had also gained time for them, so that they could send to fetch three noblemen who had been rendered unable to take part in the elections by the wiles of the other party.

column2: Two noble gentlemen, who had a weakness for strong drink, had been made drunk by the partisans of Snetkov, and a third had been robbed of his uniform.
column3: Two noble gentlemen, who had a weakness for strong drink, had been made drunk by the partisans of Snetkov, and a third had been robbed of his uniform.

column2: On learning this, the new party had made haste, during the dispute about Flerov, to send some of their men in a sledge to clothe the stripped gentleman, and to bring along one of the intoxicated to the meeting.
column3: On learning this, the new party had made haste, during the dispute about Flerov, to send some of their men in a sledge to clothe the stripped gentleman, and to bring along one of the intoxicated to the meeting.

column2: He's all right?	He's all right?
